trans-unit.source: Serializes a set of components into a serialization store.
The CodeDomComponentSerializationService class serializes a set of components or serializable objects into a serialization store.
The store can then be deserialized at a later time.
The CodeDomComponentSerializationService class differs from other serialization schemes in that the serialization format is opaque, and it allows for partial serialization of objects.
For example, you can choose to serialize only selected properties for an object.

The base class, <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.ComponentSerializationService>, replaces the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationService> interface from the .NET Framework version 1.0, although the latter is retained for backward compatibility.

The CodeDomComponentSerializationService class does not implement the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationService> interface, but if you query for <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationService>, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.CodeDomDesignerLoader> provides a bridge implementation to ensure backward compatibility.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.CodeDomComponentSerializationService"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.CodeDomComponentSerializationService"></xref> class using the given service provider to resolve services.
An <xref:System.IServiceProvider> to use for resolving services.
Creates a new <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.SerializationStore"></xref>.

The serialization store can be passed to any of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.CodeDomComponentSerializationService.Serialize%2A> methods to build up serialization state for a group of objects.
A new serialization store.
Deserializes the given store to produce a collection of objects.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.SerializationStore"></xref> from which objects will be deserialized.
A collection of deserialized components.
store is .
store is not a supported type of serialization store.
Use a store returned by <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.CodeDomComponentSerializationService.CreateStore*>.
Deserializes the given store and populates the given <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IContainer"></xref> with deserialized <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> objects.
Created objects that implement the <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent> interface will be added to the `container` parameter.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.SerializationStore"></xref> from which objects will be deserialized.
A container to which <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> objects will be added.
A collection of deserialized components.
store or container is .
store is not a supported type of serialization store.
Use a store returned by <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.CodeDomComponentSerializationService.CreateStore*>.
Deserializes the given <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.SerializationStore"></xref> to the given container, optionally applying default property values.

The DeserializeTo method deserializes the given store, but rather than producing new objects, the data in the store is applied to an existing set of objects that are taken from the `container` parameter.
As a result, the caller can create in advance an object however it sees fit.
If an object has deserialization state and the object is not named in the set of existing objects, a new object will be created.
If that object also implements <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent>, it will be added to the given container.
Objects in the container must have names and types that match objects in the serialization store in order for an existing object to be used.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.SerializationStore"></xref> from which the objects will be deserialized.
A container of objects to which data will be applied.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to validate the recycled type; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to apply default property values; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
store or container is .
store is not a supported type of serialization store.
Use a store returned by <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.CodeDomComponentSerializationService.CreateStore*>.
Loads a <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.SerializationStore"></xref> from the given stream.
You can use the returned store to deserialize objects by passing it to the various <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.CodeDomComponentSerializationService.Deserialize%2A> methods.
The stream from which to load the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.SerializationStore"></xref>.
The loaded <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.SerializationStore"></xref>.
stream is .
stream supports seeking, but its length is 0.
Serializes the given object to the given <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.SerializationStore"></xref>.
The `store` parameter can be used to serialize more than one object by calling this method once for each object.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.SerializationStore"></xref> to which `value` will be serialized.
The object to serialize.
store or value is .
store is closed, or store is not a supported type of serialization store.
Use a store returned by <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.CodeDomComponentSerializationService.CreateStore*>.
Serializes the given object, accounting for default property values.
The store can be used to serialize more than one object by calling this method more than once.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.SerializationStore"></xref> to which `value` will be serialized.
The object to serialize.
store or value is .
store is closed, or store is not a supported type of serialization store.
Use a store returned by <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.CodeDomComponentSerializationService.CreateStore*>.
Serializes the given member on the given object.
This method can be invoked multiple times for the same object to build up a list of serialized members within the serialization store.
The member generally has to be a property or an event.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.SerializationStore"></xref> to which `member` will be serialized.
The object that owns the `member`.
The given member.
store, owningObject, or member is .
store is closed, or store is not a supported type of serialization store.
Use a store returned by <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.CodeDomComponentSerializationService.CreateStore*>.
Serializes the given member on the given object, but also serializes the member if it contains the default property value.
For some members, containing the default property value and setting the same value back to the member are different concepts.
For example, if a property inherits its value from a parent object if no local value is set, setting the value back to the property may not be what is desired.
The SerializeMemberAbsolute method takes this into account and would clear the state of the property in this case.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.SerializationStore"></xref> to which `member` will be serialized.
The object that owns the `member`.
The given member.
store, owningObject, or member is .
store is closed, or store is not a supported type of serialization store.
Use a store returned by <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.CodeDomComponentSerializationService.CreateStore*>.
